page.title: 10Elton Youth Hostel
page.content: Almost in the centre of Elton stands the Old Hall, built in 1668 and now listed as a building of architectural and historical interest. This was acquired by the Youth Hostel Association in 1942 and since then has been a Simple Grade Hostel. It is one of the smallest hostels in the Peak District having just 34 beds in five rooms. Hostellers cook their own meals in the well-equipped kitchen but the Warden, a woman, cooks snack meals on request. Elton Y.H. has visitors from this country and abroad and is regularly used by School and College groups as a base for exploring the White Peak of Derbyshire. Bed-night charges are Â£1.40 (up to 16), Â£1.80 (16 to 20> and Â£2.15 for Seniors.
